entities.name: Toolbox
entities.description: Main panel containing Photoshop tools, usually on the left side

entities.name: Pull Down Menus
entities.description: Menus across the top of Photoshop window

entities.name: File Menu
entities.description: Menu to open, close, save files

entities.name: Open
entities.description: Open image files

entities.name: Close
entities.description: Close open images

entities.name: Save As
entities.description: Save image with a new name or location

entities.name: Edit Menu
entities.description: Menu containing undo and fill commands

entities.name: Undo (Control+Z)
entities.description: Undo last action

entities.name: Fill
entities.description: Fill selected area with color or pattern

entities.name: Image Menu
entities.description: Menu for image adjustments and mode changes

entities.name: Image Rotation
entities.description: Rotate the image 90 degrees or flip horizontal/vertical

entities.name: Mode
entities.description: Change image color mode (e.g., RGB to Grayscale)

entities.name: Adjustments
entities.description: Submenu for image adjustments like Levels, Hue and Saturation, Color Balance

entities.name: Levels
entities.description: Adjust shadows, midtones, and highlights of an image

entities.name: Hue and Saturation
entities.description: Adjust image color hue, saturation and lightness

entities.name: Color Balance
entities.description: Adjust color tones in shadows, midtones, highlights

entities.name: Select Menu
entities.description: Menu for selection adjustments

entities.name: Modify
entities.description: Modify selection boundaries

entities.name: Feather
entities.description: Softens edges of a selection

entities.name: Inverse
entities.description: Invert the current selection

entities.name: Move Tool
entities.description: Moves selections and layers

entities.name: Hand Tool
entities.description: Moves view of zoomed image

entities.name: Zoom Tool
entities.description: Zooms in and out of images

entities.name: Crop Tool
entities.description: Creates a cropping box to remove parts of an image

entities.name: Lasso Tool
entities.description: Freehand selection tool

entities.name: Polygonal Lasso
entities.description: Creates straight-edge selections

entities.name: Magnetic Lasso
entities.description: Snaps selection to edges based on contrast

entities.name: Dodge Tool
entities.description: Lightens selected areas of a photo

entities.name: Burn Tool
entities.description: Darkens selected areas of a photo

entities.name: Sponge Tool
entities.description: Adjusts color saturation

entities.name: Magic Wand Tool
entities.description: Selects areas based on color similarity

entities.name: Clone Stamp Tool
entities.description: Copies pixels from one area to another; used for cloning

entities.name: History Palette
entities.description: Shows history of recent actions; allows going back to earlier states

entities.name: Preferences Window
entities.description: Settings for Photoshop; can change History States among others

entities.name: Range Dropdown
entities.description: Sets tonal range to affect (Midtones, Highlights, Shadows)

entities.name: Exposure Slider
entities.description: Adjusts strength of dodge or burn effect

entities.name: Tolerance Field
entities.description: Sets color similarity threshold for Magic Wand selection

entities.name: Opacity Field
entities.description: Sets opacity level for Fill command

entities.name: Contents Dropdown
entities.description: Selects fill content such as Black, White, Pattern

entities.name: Blending Mode Dropdown
entities.description: Sets blending mode for fill

entities.name: Bracket Keys
entities.description: Increase [ ] or decrease brush/dodge/burn tool size

entities.name: Control + D
entities.description: Deselect current selection

entities.name: Control + Z
entities.description: Undo last action

entities.name: Alt + Mouse Click
entities.description: Sets clone source point

entities.name: Filter Menu
entities.description: Menu to apply image filters

entities.name: Artistic Filter MenuItem
entities.description: Applies artistic style filters

entities.name: Colored Pencil Filter
entities.description: Creates colored pencil drawing effect

entities.name: Brush Strokes Filter
entities.description: Applies brush stroke effects

entities.name: Distort Filter
entities.description: Distorts the image

entities.name: Sketch Filter
entities.description: Creates sketch effects

entities.name: Stylize Filter
entities.description: Stylizes the image

entities.name: Texture Filter
entities.description: Applies texture effects

entities.name: Unsharp Mask Filter
entities.description: Sharpens images, used to compensate printing loss

entities.name: Save Button
entities.description: Save changes to current image

entities.name: New Folder Button
entities.description: Create new folder to save images into

entities.name: OK Button
entities.description: Confirm level changes

entities.name: Cancel Button
entities.description: Cancel changes

entities.name: Zoom
entities.description: Allows navigating in and out of a photo by magnifying or shrinking the view

entities.name: Navigate
entities.description: Moving around an image when zoomed in to see different parts of the photo

entities.name: Crop
entities.description: Changes the shape of the image by cutting parts off to improve composition or remove distractions

entities.name: Straighten Horizon
entities.description: Using the crop tool's rotate function to correct tilted photos and make horizon lines horizontal

entities.name: Rotate
entities.description: Turning an image by 90 degrees or flipping horizontally or vertically

entities.name: Image Adjustments
entities.description: Adjusting various image parameters such as levels, color, contrast, brightness, and toning to improve photo quality

entities.name: Selection Tools
entities.description: Tools used to select specific areas of a photo for isolated editing

entities.name: Polygonal Lasso Tool
entities.description: Selects areas by drawing straight line segments between anchor points

entities.name: Magnetic Lasso Tool
entities.description: Automatically snaps selection to edges of objects by detecting contrast

entities.name: Filters
entities.description: Effects applied to images to create artistic or dramatic changes, often easy to use but rarely ethical for photojournalism

entities.name: Artistic Filters
entities.description: A category of filters including effects like Colored Pencil to alter the image style

entities.name: Undo
entities.description: Reverts the last change made to the image

entities.name: Control+Z
entities.description: Keyboard shortcut to undo the last action

entities.name: Alt Key + Mouse Click
entities.description: Used to define the source area for cloning or to zoom out

entities.name: Enter Key
entities.description: Confirms cropping or other dialog actions

entities.name: Control Key + + or -
entities.description: Keyboard shortcuts to zoom in (+) or zoom out (-) on an image

entities.name: Control+D
entities.description: Deselects the current selection

entities.name: File Menu > Save As
entities.description: Menu path used to save an edited image as a new file

entities.name: Image Resolution
entities.description: A measurement of the amount of detail in an image, typically pixels per inch (ppi). Higher resolution equals more pixels and better quality

entities.name: Pixel
entities.description: The smallest unit or element of a digital image

entities.name: RGB Mode
entities.description: Red, Green, Blue color mode used for color digital images

entities.name: Grayscale Mode
entities.description: A mode converting images to black and white without color

entities.name: Duotone
entities.description: An image that appears black and white with one additional color added to create tonal effects

entities.name: Histogram
entities.description: Graphical representation of the tonal values (dark, mid, bright) of an image used to understand exposure and levels

entities.name: Overexposed
entities.description: When too much light reaches the camera's sensor resulting in loss of detail in bright areas, difficult or impossible to fix fully in Photoshop

entities.name: Underexposed
entities.description: When not enough light reaches the camera's sensor resulting in loss of detail in dark areas; can sometimes be improved in Photoshop

entities.name: Exposure
entities.description: The amount of light allowed to reach the camera sensor to capture an image

entities.name: Toning
entities.description: A general term for changing the image’s color, saturation, contrast, and overall color balance

entities.name: Clone Size Adjustment
entities.description: Adjustment of Clone Stamp or Dodge/Burn brush size using bracket keys

entities.name: Tolerance
entities.description: Control for Magic Wand Tool to adjust range of colors selected based on similarity

entities.name: Feather Settings
entities.description: Pixel range (typically 1 to 5) used to soften edges of a selection

entities.name: History States
entities.description: Number of steps Photoshop remembers for undoing actions in the History palette; can be set to 50 or higher

entities.name: Selection
entities.description: An active area chosen on the image to apply changes to only that part

entities.name: Save
entities.description: Writes changes to the current image file, replacing original image

entities.name: Acceptable Image Quality for Print
entities.description: Print images require high resolution, typically 300 pixels per inch or more, to achieve good quality

entities.name: Web Image Quality
entities.description: Images for web use generally have low resolution of 72 pixels per inch, which is insufficient for print

entities.name: Exposure Range Adjustment via Levels
entities.description: Adjusting black and white triangles on histogram in Levels to properly set tonal range

entities.name: RGB
entities.description: The color mode used in Photoshop representing Red, Green, and Blue color channels

entities.name: Grayscale
entities.description: A color mode converting the image to black and white without color information

entities.name: Image Mode
entities.description: The color space or mode in which the image is stored, e.g., RGB, Grayscale, Duotone

entities.name: Flip Horizontal
entities.description: Mirrors an image along the vertical axis

entities.name: Flip Vertical
entities.description: Mirrors an image along the horizontal axis

entities.name: Control Key + D
entities.description: Shortcut to deselect a selection

entities.name: Shift + Click
entities.description: Adds to an existing selection in tools like Magic Wand

entities.name: Alt + Click
entities.description: Removes from an existing selection or defines cloning source point

entities.name: Acceptable Cropping Outcome
entities.description: An image cropped to remove distractions, improve composition by changing image shape and subject placement

entities.name: Dodged Image
entities.description: Image lighter in selected areas after using the Dodge Tool

entities.name: Burned Image
entities.description: Image darker in selected areas after using the Burn Tool

entities.name: Cloned Image
entities.description: Image repaired or manipulated by copying pixel areas to other locations using the Clone Stamp Tool

entities.name: Selected Area
entities.description: An area isolated by selection tools where editing changes will be applied

entities.name: Grading Guide Images
entities.description: Final example images used as a reference to evaluate student work for correctness and quality

entities.name: Image Mode Change
entities.description: Changing an image’s color mode between RGB, Grayscale or Duotone

procedures.name: Navigate and Zoom on an Image
procedures.description: Navigate through a photo and zoom in and out using tools and keyboard shortcuts
steps: Go to File Menu > Open, browse to folder 01-Crop and open photo '00 Navigate-magnify-1'
In the Toolbox, mouse click once on the Zoom Tool (magnifying glass icon)
Move the Zoom Tool over the photo and click several times to zoom IN
Find the Hand Tool in the Toolbox, click once and hold, then drag to move around the magnified image
Hold down the Alt key and mouse click to zoom OUT
Double mouse click on the Hand Tool in the Toolbox to quickly return to full sized image
Alternatively, use keyboard shortcuts: hold Control key and press '+' to zoom in or '-' to zoom out
When done, go to File Menu > Close without saving changes
prerequisites: Adobe Photoshop open
Image file '00 Navigate-magnify-1' available in folder 01-Crop
procedures.outcome: User can zoom and navigate around an image proficiently in Photoshop

procedures.name: Crop and Straighten an Image
procedures.description: Use the Crop Tool to crop parts of an image, straighten the horizon, and rotate as needed
steps: Open the target image for cropping (e.g., '01-Crop' or images like '02-Crop in tight')
Click once on the Crop Tool in the Toolbox
Click and hold, then drag across the image to create a cropping box
Adjust the crop box by clicking and dragging the small square handles on the corners and sides to reposition or resize the crop area
To straighten a horizon, create a crop box smaller than the image
Hover near a corner outside the crop box until the cursor changes to a curved arrow
Click and drag to rotate the crop box to straighten the horizon
Double click inside the crop box or press Enter to apply the crop and/or straighten
For rotating images, open the image and go to Image Menu > Image Rotation, try rotating 90 degrees or flipping horizontal/vertical
When done, save the modified image using File Menu > Save As, choose location and folder named with user’s name, then press Save
Use Control + Z to undo mistakes if needed
Close the original image without saving if you want to preserve it
prerequisites: Adobe Photoshop open
Images for cropping available in folders as specified
procedures.outcome: Image is cropped, straightened, rotated, and saved without overwriting the original file

procedures.name: Save Edited Image for Instructor
procedures.description: Save an edited photo in a new folder named with user's name to preserve the original and organize student work
steps: Go to File Menu > Save As
Set the destination location to Desktop
Click on New Folder to create a new folder
Name the folder with your name
Press Save to save the image inside this folder
prerequisites: Edited image open in Photoshop
procedures.outcome: Edited image is saved in a uniquely named folder on the desktop, preserving the original image

procedures.name: Undo and Use History Palette in Photoshop
procedures.description: Use undo commands and the History palette to revert and correct mistakes made during editing
steps: Press Control + Z on the keyboard to undo the last action
To undo earlier steps, go to Window Menu > History to display the History palette
Click on any step in the History palette to revert the image to that state
To increase the number of saved history states, go to Photoshop Menu > Preferences > Performance
Change the History States value to 50 or higher
Close Preferences window
prerequisites: Any image open and being edited in Photoshop
procedures.outcome: Ability to undo multiple editing steps and revert to earlier versions of the image

procedures.name: Adjust Image Levels
procedures.description: Set the tonal values of an image by adjusting Levels for improved contrast and color
steps: Open photo '01-Levels-1' from folder '02-Image Adjust & color correct'
Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Levels
Observe the histogram representing tonal values (dark tones on left, midtones in middle, bright tones on right)
Use the mouse to move the two outer triangles (black and white sliders) so they align under the ends of the histogram
Press OK to apply changes
Observe the image for improved tones, color, and contrast
Optionally, open other level practice photos like 'Levels 02' and 'Levels 03', adjust Levels similarly
Do a Save As to save your work
prerequisites: Image open in Photoshop
Folder '02-Image Adjust & color correct' with relevant photos
procedures.outcome: Image tonal range and contrast are properly adjusted for better visual quality

procedures.name: Convert RGB Image to Grayscale
procedures.description: Turn a color image into a black and white image by changing image modes
steps: Open photo '02-RGB to grayscale-1' from folder '02-Image Adjust'
Go to Image Menu > Mode > Grayscale
Confirm conversion to black and white
Perform Save As to save the converted image
Alternatively, reopen unchanged version of photo
Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Hue and Saturation
Slide the saturation triangle all the way left (-100) to desaturate color but keep RGB mode
Close photo and do NOT save changes if testing alternate method
prerequisites: Adobe Photoshop open
Image '02-RGB to grayscale-1' available
procedures.outcome: Color image is converted to a grayscale black and white image, saved as a new file

procedures.name: Convert Grayscale Image to RGB and Create Duotone
procedures.description: Change a black and white image back to RGB color mode and add color toning to create a duotone effect
steps: Open image '03-Gray scale to RGB-Duotone-1'
Go to Image Menu > Mode > RGB Color to convert to color mode
Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Color Balance
Slide the Red slider in Shadows and Midtones to around +35 to add red color tone
Try adjusting slider to different values or add other colors for effect
Do a Save As to save the duotone image
prerequisites: Grayscale image '03-Gray scale to RGB-Duotone-1' open in Photoshop
procedures.outcome: Black and white image has color added to create a duotone effect and saved as new image

procedures.name: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance
procedures.description: Adjust color and saturation in an image to correct color casts and improve accuracy
steps: Open photo '04-color correct-1' from folder '02 image adjust'
Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Hue and Saturation
Slide Saturation slider right to +60 to observe dominant colors and left to reduce saturation, then return to 0
Select the 'Master' dropdown and select 'Blues'
Move Saturation slider left to about -15 or -20 to desaturate blues
Repeat for Cyan if needed
Compare original vs. desaturated version to judge improvement
Save As the corrected image in your folder
For photo '05-color correct-1', similarly open, go to Hue and Saturation
Increase and then decrease saturation of Blue and Cyan channels to reduce unwanted blue tint in hair and skin tones
Do a Save As, renaming to 'color balance example'
prerequisites: Photoshop open with image '04-color correct-1' or '05-color correct-1'
procedures.outcome: Image color cast corrected for more natural appearance, especially reducing excessive blue or cyan tones

procedures.name: Use Dodge Tool to Lighten Selected Areas
procedures.description: Lighten specific areas of an image using the Dodge Tool with appropriate settings
steps: Open photo '01-dodge and burn 1'
In the Toolbar, click and hold on the Burn/Dodge Tool icon until the Dodge Tool appears; select it
Adjust the Dodge Tool brush size using right (increase) and left (decrease) bracket keys to match the area to be lightened
Ensure Caps Lock on keyboard is off
On the upper left, set Range to Midtones and Exposure to around 25-35%
Click and hold with mouse and 'scroll' (move mouse) for 10-15 seconds over area to lighten (banner at far right)
Change Range to Highlights and set Exposure to 10%, then repeat dodging for 5-10 seconds
Do not use multiple repeated clicks; click and hold while moving mouse for efficiency
prerequisites: Photoshop open with image '01-dodge and burn 1' from folder '03-dodge and burn'
procedures.outcome: Selected areas in the image are lightened subtly and effectively to increase visibility and impact

procedures.name: Use Burn Tool to Darken Selected Areas
procedures.description: Darken specific areas of an image using the Burn Tool with proper brush size and exposure
steps: Find the Burn Tool in the Toolbox (may need to hold Dodge Tool to reveal it)
Adjust brush size using bracket keys
Set Range to Midtones and Exposure to 25-35%
Click and hold with mouse and scroll over the area to darken (banner near center of photo) for 10-15 seconds
Optionally set Range to Highlights at 10% and apply additional burning
Use click-and-hold-and-scroll method, avoid repeated clicking
Do a Save As to store changes
prerequisites: Photoshop open with image '01-dodge and burn 1'
procedures.outcome: Selected areas in the photo are darkened effectively without obvious artifacts

procedures.name: Practice Dodging and Burning on Images with Contrasting Light
procedures.description: Improve photos with both sunny and shaded areas by selectively dodging and burning
steps: Open photo '02-Dodge and Burn-1'
Use Burn Tool to darken the sky area, adjusting brush size as needed and being careful not to overdo it
Use Dodge Tool to lighten the shaded areas
Try burning midtones and dodging shadows at around 10% exposure
Save the edited image with Save As
prerequisites: Photoshop open with image '02-Dodge and Burn-1'
procedures.outcome: Image with improved exposure balance between light and shadowed areas

procedures.name: Dodge and Burn Practice on Overexposed and Underexposed Areas
procedures.description: Attempt to improve a photo with difficult exposure issues using dodge and burn tools
steps: Open photo '03-Dodge and Burn-Cat-1'
Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Levels and note histogram extends to ends indicating overexposure
Try using Dodge Tool to lighten shadow areas, understanding limited effect due to lack of image data
Try using Burn Tool on bright areas, noting it may only add gray tones without recovering details
Press OK without adjusting Levels in dialog
Close the photo without saving changes
prerequisites: Photoshop open with image '03-Dodge and Burn-Cat-1'
procedures.outcome: Understanding that dodge and burn have limited effect on poorly exposed images

procedures.name: Dodge Midtones to Brighten Dark Areas
procedures.description: Lighten dark areas of a photo using dodge on midtones without aiming for perfection
steps: Open photo '04-Dodge and Burn-1'
Use Dodge Tool set to midtones
Adjust brush size as needed
Click and hold and scroll over dark areas to brighten them
Avoid overdoing and do not try to make it perfect
Do a Save As to save your work
prerequisites: Photoshop open with image '04-Dodge and Burn-1'
procedures.outcome: Improved visibility in darker parts with natural look maintained

procedures.name: Select and Edit Areas Using Magic Wand Tool
procedures.description: Select areas of similar color or tone with Magic Wand, feather selection, and adjust Levels on selection
steps: Open photo '01-Magic Wand-1'
In Toolbox, click once on Magic Wand Tool
Set Tolerance to 15 in upper left screen
Click once inside the white wall area to select it
If selection is incorrect, press Control + D to deselect and try again
Go to Select Menu > Modify > Feather and set pixels between 1 and 3
Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Levels
Adjust levels as desired affecting only selected area
Try selecting blue sky area by clicking in parts with Magic Wand while holding Shift key to add to selection
Use Select > Modify > Feather with 1 to 5 pixels
Deselect selection with Control + D when done
Try changing Tolerance values and observe effect
Save the edited image as required
prerequisites: Photoshop open with photo '01-Magic Wand-1' in folder '04 selection tools'
procedures.outcome: Selected areas with similar colors adjusted precisely without changing other parts of image

procedures.name: Select and Edit Areas Using Lasso Tools
procedures.description: Use Lasso Tools including Magnetic and Polygonal Lasso to select specific areas for editing
steps: Open photo '02-Magnetic Lasso'
In Toolbox, click and hold Lasso Tool icon and choose Magnetic Lasso
Click once on edge of object to set anchor point
Move mouse around edge; Magnetic Lasso will snap along edges
Click once to set additional anchor points while tracing
Complete selection by clicking once when cursor changes to small circle
Use Shift + Click to add to selection if parts missed
Use Alt + Click to remove unwanted areas from selection
After selection, go to Select Menu > Modify > Feather and set 1 to 3 pixels
Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Levels and adjust inside selection
Try Select > Inverse to reverse selection
Use Edit > Fill with black to fill background or other actions
Save edited image as needed
Similarly, practice with Polygonal Lasso Tool by clicking to set points with straight lines around desired selection
Use Shift and Alt keys to add and remove from selection as needed
Feather selection, adjust Levels, fill or make other edits then Save As
prerequisites: Photoshop open with photos for selection practice
procedures.outcome: Accurate selections made on images enabling targeted editing and background manipulation

procedures.name: Use Clone Stamp Tool to Repair and Manipulate Images
procedures.description: Use Clone Stamp Tool to copy pixels from one area of an image to another for cleaning or repairing
steps: Open cloning target image (e.g., '01-clone-1', '02-clone-1')
Select Clone Stamp Tool from Toolbox (rubber stamp icon)
Set brush size using bracket keys to match areas being cloned
Hold Alt key and click once on area to copy pixels from
Move cursor over the area to fix and click once or click and hold while moving to copy pixels there
Repeat Alt + click to pick new source areas as needed
Do not use repeated clicking, instead click and hold and smoothly paint for better results
Use History palette to undo changes if unsatisfied
Do a Save As to save edits
Practice on other images removing writing, fixing holes or smoothing areas
Discuss ethical use of cloning especially in photojournalism context
prerequisites: Photoshop open with appropriate images for cloning in folder '05 Cloning'
procedures.outcome: Image areas cleaned or repaired using cloning with controlled and smoother results

procedures.name: Apply and Experiment with Filters to an Image
procedures.description: Use Photoshop filters to alter the artistic appearance of photos and combine with selections and level adjustments
steps: Open any photo from folder 06 Filters
Go to Filter Menu > Artistic and select Colored Pencil or other filters to apply
Experiment with different filters and their settings, noting some filters may take time to apply
Try other filter categories such as Brush Strokes, Distort, Sketch, Stylize, and Texture
Open photo 'Filters-05-1' for advanced exercise
Use Magnetic Lasso Tool to select top flower, apply Select > Modify > Feather (1-3 pixels), apply a conspicuous filter
Repeat for bottom flower with a different filter
Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Levels with selection active to further modify
Hold Shift key to add to selection, select both flowers
Select > Inverse, desaturate outside flowers using Hue and Saturation, reducing Saturation
Adjust levels improperly for artistic effect by moving histogram sliders to the left
Select > Inverse again to reselect flowers and adjust Levels incorrectly to middle
Use History palette to undo as needed
Do a Save As to save the artistic image
Close photos without saving if desired
prerequisites: Photoshop open with photos for filters in folder '06 Filters'
procedures.outcome: Images are artistically altered with filters, selections, and level adjustments demonstrating Photoshop’s creative power

triples.head: Navigate and Zoom on an Image
triples.tail: User can zoom and navigate around an image proficiently in Photoshop

triples.head: Go to File Menu > Open, browse to folder 01-Crop and open photo '00 Navigate-magnify-1'
triples.tail: Navigate and Zoom on an Image

triples.head: In the Toolbox, mouse click once on the Zoom Tool (magnifying glass icon)
triples.tail: Navigate and Zoom on an Image

triples.head: Go to File Menu > Open, browse to folder 01-Crop and open photo '00 Navigate-magnify-1'
triples.tail: In the Toolbox, mouse click once on the Zoom Tool (magnifying glass icon)

triples.head: Move the Zoom Tool over the photo and click several times to zoom IN
triples.tail: Navigate and Zoom on an Image

triples.head: In the Toolbox, mouse click once on the Zoom Tool (magnifying glass icon)
triples.tail: Move the Zoom Tool over the photo and click several times to zoom IN

triples.head: Find the Hand Tool in the Toolbox, click once and hold, then drag to move around the magnified image
triples.tail: Navigate and Zoom on an Image

triples.head: Move the Zoom Tool over the photo and click several times to zoom IN
triples.tail: Find the Hand Tool in the Toolbox, click once and hold, then drag to move around the magnified image

triples.head: Hold down the Alt key and mouse click to zoom OUT
triples.tail: Navigate and Zoom on an Image

triples.head: Find the Hand Tool in the Toolbox, click once and hold, then drag to move around the magnified image
triples.tail: Hold down the Alt key and mouse click to zoom OUT

triples.head: Double mouse click on the Hand Tool in the Toolbox to quickly return to full sized image
triples.tail: Navigate and Zoom on an Image

triples.head: Hold down the Alt key and mouse click to zoom OUT
triples.tail: Double mouse click on the Hand Tool in the Toolbox to quickly return to full sized image

triples.head: Alternatively, use keyboard shortcuts: hold Control key and press '+' to zoom in or '-' to zoom out
triples.tail: Navigate and Zoom on an Image

triples.head: Double mouse click on the Hand Tool in the Toolbox to quickly return to full sized image
triples.tail: Alternatively, use keyboard shortcuts: hold Control key and press '+' to zoom in or '-' to zoom out

triples.head: When done, go to File Menu > Close without saving changes
triples.tail: Navigate and Zoom on an Image

triples.head: Alternatively, use keyboard shortcuts: hold Control key and press '+' to zoom in or '-' to zoom out
triples.tail: When done, go to File Menu > Close without saving changes

triples.head: Crop and Straighten an Image
triples.tail: Image is cropped, straightened, rotated, and saved without overwriting the original file

triples.head: Open the target image for cropping (e.g., '01-Crop' or images like '02-Crop in tight')
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: Click once on the Crop Tool in the Toolbox
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: Open the target image for cropping (e.g., '01-Crop' or images like '02-Crop in tight')
triples.tail: Click once on the Crop Tool in the Toolbox

triples.head: Click and hold, then drag across the image to create a cropping box
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: Click once on the Crop Tool in the Toolbox
triples.tail: Click and hold, then drag across the image to create a cropping box

triples.head: Adjust the crop box by clicking and dragging the small square handles on the corners and sides to reposition or resize the crop area
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: Click and hold, then drag across the image to create a cropping box
triples.tail: Adjust the crop box by clicking and dragging the small square handles on the corners and sides to reposition or resize the crop area

triples.head: To straighten a horizon, create a crop box smaller than the image
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: Adjust the crop box by clicking and dragging the small square handles on the corners and sides to reposition or resize the crop area
triples.tail: To straighten a horizon, create a crop box smaller than the image

triples.head: Hover near a corner outside the crop box until the cursor changes to a curved arrow
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: To straighten a horizon, create a crop box smaller than the image
triples.tail: Hover near a corner outside the crop box until the cursor changes to a curved arrow

triples.head: Click and drag to rotate the crop box to straighten the horizon
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: Hover near a corner outside the crop box until the cursor changes to a curved arrow
triples.tail: Click and drag to rotate the crop box to straighten the horizon

triples.head: Double click inside the crop box or press Enter to apply the crop and/or straighten
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: Click and drag to rotate the crop box to straighten the horizon
triples.tail: Double click inside the crop box or press Enter to apply the crop and/or straighten

triples.head: For rotating images, open the image and go to Image Menu > Image Rotation, try rotating 90 degrees or flipping horizontal/vertical
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: Double click inside the crop box or press Enter to apply the crop and/or straighten
triples.tail: For rotating images, open the image and go to Image Menu > Image Rotation, try rotating 90 degrees or flipping horizontal/vertical

triples.head: When done, save the modified image using File Menu > Save As, choose location and folder named with user’s name, then press Save
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: For rotating images, open the image and go to Image Menu > Image Rotation, try rotating 90 degrees or flipping horizontal/vertical
triples.tail: When done, save the modified image using File Menu > Save As, choose location and folder named with user’s name, then press Save

triples.head: Use Control + Z to undo mistakes if needed
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: When done, save the modified image using File Menu > Save As, choose location and folder named with user’s name, then press Save
triples.tail: Use Control + Z to undo mistakes if needed

triples.head: Close the original image without saving if you want to preserve it
triples.tail: Crop and Straighten an Image

triples.head: Use Control + Z to undo mistakes if needed
triples.tail: Close the original image without saving if you want to preserve it

triples.head: Save Edited Image for Instructor
triples.tail: Edited image is saved in a uniquely named folder on the desktop, preserving the original image

triples.head: Go to File Menu > Save As
triples.tail: Save Edited Image for Instructor

triples.head: Set the destination location to Desktop
triples.tail: Save Edited Image for Instructor

triples.head: Go to File Menu > Save As
triples.tail: Set the destination location to Desktop

triples.head: Click on New Folder to create a new folder
triples.tail: Save Edited Image for Instructor

triples.head: Set the destination location to Desktop
triples.tail: Click on New Folder to create a new folder

triples.head: Name the folder with your name
triples.tail: Save Edited Image for Instructor

triples.head: Click on New Folder to create a new folder
triples.tail: Name the folder with your name

triples.head: Press Save to save the image inside this folder
triples.tail: Save Edited Image for Instructor

triples.head: Name the folder with your name
triples.tail: Press Save to save the image inside this folder

triples.head: Undo and Use History Palette in Photoshop
triples.tail: Ability to undo multiple editing steps and revert to earlier versions of the image

triples.head: Press Control + Z on the keyboard to undo the last action
triples.tail: Undo and Use History Palette in Photoshop

triples.head: To undo earlier steps, go to Window Menu > History to display the History palette
triples.tail: Undo and Use History Palette in Photoshop

triples.head: Press Control + Z on the keyboard to undo the last action
triples.tail: To undo earlier steps, go to Window Menu > History to display the History palette

triples.head: Click on any step in the History palette to revert the image to that state
triples.tail: Undo and Use History Palette in Photoshop

triples.head: To undo earlier steps, go to Window Menu > History to display the History palette
triples.tail: Click on any step in the History palette to revert the image to that state

triples.head: To increase the number of saved history states, go to Photoshop Menu > Preferences > Performance
triples.tail: Undo and Use History Palette in Photoshop

triples.head: Click on any step in the History palette to revert the image to that state
triples.tail: To increase the number of saved history states, go to Photoshop Menu > Preferences > Performance

triples.head: Change the History States value to 50 or higher
triples.tail: Undo and Use History Palette in Photoshop

triples.head: To increase the number of saved history states, go to Photoshop Menu > Preferences > Performance
triples.tail: Change the History States value to 50 or higher

triples.head: Close Preferences window
triples.tail: Undo and Use History Palette in Photoshop

triples.head: Change the History States value to 50 or higher
triples.tail: Close Preferences window

triples.head: Adjust Image Levels
triples.tail: Image tonal range and contrast are properly adjusted for better visual quality

triples.head: Open photo '01-Levels-1' from folder '02-Image Adjust & color correct'
triples.tail: Adjust Image Levels

triples.head: Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Levels
triples.tail: Adjust Image Levels

triples.head: Open photo '01-Levels-1' from folder '02-Image Adjust & color correct'
triples.tail: Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Levels

triples.head: Observe the histogram representing tonal values (dark tones on left, midtones in middle, bright tones on right)
triples.tail: Adjust Image Levels

triples.head: Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Levels
triples.tail: Observe the histogram representing tonal values (dark tones on left, midtones in middle, bright tones on right)

triples.head: Use the mouse to move the two outer triangles (black and white sliders) so they align under the ends of the histogram
triples.tail: Adjust Image Levels

triples.head: Observe the histogram representing tonal values (dark tones on left, midtones in middle, bright tones on right)
triples.tail: Use the mouse to move the two outer triangles (black and white sliders) so they align under the ends of the histogram

triples.head: Press OK to apply changes
triples.tail: Adjust Image Levels

triples.head: Use the mouse to move the two outer triangles (black and white sliders) so they align under the ends of the histogram
triples.tail: Press OK to apply changes

triples.head: Observe the image for improved tones, color, and contrast
triples.tail: Adjust Image Levels

triples.head: Press OK to apply changes
triples.tail: Observe the image for improved tones, color, and contrast

triples.head: Optionally, open other level practice photos like 'Levels 02' and 'Levels 03', adjust Levels similarly
triples.tail: Adjust Image Levels

triples.head: Observe the image for improved tones, color, and contrast
triples.tail: Optionally, open other level practice photos like 'Levels 02' and 'Levels 03', adjust Levels similarly

triples.head: Do a Save As to save your work

triples.head: Optionally, open other level practice photos like 'Levels 02' and 'Levels 03', adjust Levels similarly

triples.head: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance
triples.tail: Image color cast corrected for more natural appearance, especially reducing excessive blue or cyan tones

triples.head: Open photo '04-color correct-1' from folder '02 image adjust'
triples.tail: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance

triples.head: Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Hue and Saturation
triples.tail: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance

triples.head: Open photo '04-color correct-1' from folder '02 image adjust'
triples.tail: Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Hue and Saturation

triples.head: Slide Saturation slider right to +60 to observe dominant colors and left to reduce saturation, then return to 0
triples.tail: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance

triples.head: Go to Image Menu > Adjustments > Hue and Saturation
triples.tail: Slide Saturation slider right to +60 to observe dominant colors and left to reduce saturation, then return to 0

triples.head: Select the 'Master' dropdown and select 'Blues'
triples.tail: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance

triples.head: Slide Saturation slider right to +60 to observe dominant colors and left to reduce saturation, then return to 0
triples.tail: Select the 'Master' dropdown and select 'Blues'

triples.head: Move Saturation slider left to about -15 or -20 to desaturate blues
triples.tail: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance

triples.head: Select the 'Master' dropdown and select 'Blues'
triples.tail: Move Saturation slider left to about -15 or -20 to desaturate blues

triples.head: Repeat for Cyan if needed
triples.tail: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance

triples.head: Move Saturation slider left to about -15 or -20 to desaturate blues
triples.tail: Repeat for Cyan if needed

triples.head: Compare original vs. desaturated version to judge improvement
triples.tail: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance

triples.head: Repeat for Cyan if needed
triples.tail: Compare original vs. desaturated version to judge improvement

triples.head: Save As the corrected image in your folder
triples.tail: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance

triples.head: Compare original vs. desaturated version to judge improvement
triples.tail: Save As the corrected image in your folder

triples.head: For photo '05-color correct-1', similarly open, go to Hue and Saturation
triples.tail: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance

triples.head: Save As the corrected image in your folder
triples.tail: For photo '05-color correct-1', similarly open, go to Hue and Saturation

triples.head: Increase and then decrease saturation of Blue and Cyan channels to reduce unwanted blue tint in hair and skin tones
triples.tail: Color Correct an Image Using Hue and Saturation and Color Balance

triples.head: For photo '05-color correct-1', similarly open, go to Hue and Saturation
triples.tail: Increase and then decrease saturation of Blue and Cyan channels to reduce unwanted blue tint in hair and skin tones

triples.head: Do a Save As, renaming to 'color balance example'

triples.head: Increase and then decrease saturation of Blue and Cyan channels to reduce unwanted blue tint in hair and skin tones
triples.tail: Do a Save As, renaming to 'color balance example'

triples.head: Use Dodge Tool to Lighten Selected Areas
triples.tail: Selected areas in the image are lightened subtly and effectively to increase visibility and impact

triples.head: Open photo '01-dodge and burn 1'
triples.tail: Use Dodge Tool to Lighten Selected Areas

triples.head: In the Toolbar, click and hold on the Burn/Dodge Tool icon until the Dodge Tool appears; select it
triples.tail: Use Dodge Tool to Lighten Selected Areas

triples.head: Open photo '01-dodge and burn 1'
triples.tail: In the Toolbar, click and hold on the Burn/Dodge Tool icon until the Dodge Tool appears; select it

triples.head: Adjust the Dodge Tool brush size using right (increase) and left (decrease) bracket keys to match the area to be lightened
triples.tail: Use Dodge Tool to Lighten Selected Areas

triples.head: In the Toolbar, click and hold on the Burn/Dodge Tool icon until the Dodge Tool appears; select it
triples.tail: Adjust the Dodge Tool brush size using right (increase) and left (decrease) bracket keys to match the area to be lightened

triples.head: Ensure Caps Lock on keyboard is off
triples.tail: Use Dodge Tool to Lighten Selected Areas

triples.head: Adjust the Dodge Tool brush size using right (increase) and left (decrease) bracket keys to match the area to be lightened
triples.tail: Ensure Caps Lock on keyboard is off

triples.head: On the upper left, set Range to Midtones and Exposure to around 25-35%
triples.tail: Use Dodge Tool to Lighten Selected Areas

triples.head: Ensure Caps Lock on keyboard is off
triples.tail: On the upper left, set Range to Midtones and Exposure to around 25-35%

triples.head: Click and hold with mouse and 'scroll' (move mouse) for 10-15 seconds over area to lighten (banner at far right)
triples.tail: Use Dodge Tool to Lighten Selected Areas

triples.head: On the upper left, set Range to Midtones and Exposure to around 25-35%
triples.tail: Click and hold with mouse and 'scroll' (move mouse) for 10-15 seconds over area to lighten (banner at far right)

triples.head: Change Range to Highlights and set Exposure to 10%, then repeat dodging for 5-10 seconds
triples.tail: Use Dodge Tool to Lighten Selected Areas

triples.head: Click and hold with mouse and 'scroll' (move mouse) for 10-15 seconds over area to lighten (banner at far right)
triples.tail: Change Range to Highlights and set Exposure to 10%, then repeat dodging for 5-10 seconds

triples.head: Do not use multiple repeated clicks; click and hold while moving mouse for efficiency
triples.tail: Use Dodge Tool to Lighten Selected Areas

triples.head: Change Range to Highlights and set Exposure to 10%, then repeat dodging for 5-10 seconds
triples.tail: Do not use multiple repeated clicks; click and hold while moving mouse for efficiency

triples.head: Set Range to Midtones and Exposure to 25-35%
triples.tail: Use Burn Tool to Darken Selected Areas

triples.head: Adjust brush size using bracket keys

triples.head: Click and hold with mouse and scroll over the area to darken (banner near center of photo) for 10-15 seconds
triples.tail: Use Burn Tool to Darken Selected Areas

triples.head: Set Range to Midtones and Exposure to 25-35%
triples.tail: Click and hold with mouse and scroll over the area to darken (banner near center of photo) for 10-15 seconds

triples.head: Optionally set Range to Highlights at 10% and apply additional burning
triples.tail: Use Burn Tool to Darken Selected Areas

triples.head: Click and hold with mouse and scroll over the area to darken (banner near center of photo) for 10-15 seconds
triples.tail: Optionally set Range to Highlights at 10% and apply additional burning

triples.head: Use click-and-hold-and-scroll method, avoid repeated clicking
triples.tail: Use Burn Tool to Darken Selected Areas

triples.head: Optionally set Range to Highlights at 10% and apply additional burning
